intro: Hieracium viduatum, commonly known as the weeping hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and its leaves are usually hairy and alternate along the stem. Hieracium viduatum is often found in disturbed soils and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
